conclusion: Determine the resultant Ampere force on the three resistance wires of the equilateral triangular conductor frame.
The equilateral triangular conductor frame is composed of uniform resistance wires placed perpendicular to a magnetic field.
Identify the magnetic force on AB as F using the formula F = I * L * B.
The circuit consists of the equilateral triangle ABC with points A and B connected to the power supply.
The current I is distributed equally among the three sections of the triangle (AB, BC, and CA).
The current in each of the segments AC and BC is equal to the current in AB.
The force on each of the segments AC and BC due to the magnetic field is F' = F.
The forces on AC and BC will have components that add up vectorially at an angle of 60Â° to each other.
The resultant force F_resultant is calculated as F * sqrt(3).
The net force is the sum of the forces on AB, AC, and BC, resulting in F_net = 2F.
